parameters.label: organization-defined elements of organizational security and privacy policy

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: Require the developer of the system, system component, or system service to:

parts.name: item
parts.prose: Produce, as an integral part of the development process, a formal policy model describing the {{ sa-17.1_prm_1 }} to be enforced; and

parts.name: item
parts.prose: Prove that the formal policy model is internally consistent and sufficient to enforce the defined elements of the organizational security and privacy policy when implemented.

parts.name: guidance
parts.prose: Formal models describe specific behaviors or security and privacy policies using formal languages, thus enabling the correctness of those behaviors and policies to be formally proven. Not all components of systems can be modeled. Generally, formal specifications are scoped to the behaviors or policies of interest, such as nondiscretionary access control policies. Organizations choose the formal modeling language and approach based on the nature of the behaviors and policies to be described and the available tools.
